title: 114_hr3284
content: The Act titled "Mary Jo Lawyer Spano Mesothelioma Patient Registry Act of 2015" establishes a patient registry for mesothelioma data collection and research under Title III of the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary will develop a patient registry to collect data on mesothelioma in the United States. The registry will be used to track epidemiology, report on patient health information, describe disease incidence, facilitate research, and examine associated factors. The Secretary will establish a registry to collect data on mesothelioma in the United States, including demographic factors and other information associated with the disease. The information will be made available to the public to support research, prevention, and treatment efforts. The registry will collect and store information on mesothelioma, including demographics, risk factors, diagnosis markers, epidemiology, natural history, prevention, detection, management, treatment approaches, and outcomes measures. The Secretary will consult with experts in epidemiology, national associations, health information technology, clinicians, and research scientists for the development of outcomes measures and coordination with other federal agencies. The Secretary will make information from the registry available to federal agencies, researchers, and the public. Privacy protections will be in place, and reports to Congress will be submitted within 18 months of the enactment of the Act. The Secretary will submit reports to Congress regarding the mesothelioma patient registry within 18 months and 4 years of the Act's enactment, outlining findings, future plans, and partnerships with research and advocacy communities. The Secretary will submit a report to Congress on the implementation of the mesothelioma patient registry, including details on its development, information collected, use guidelines, and coordination with other databases.
